mornning9365 [Aug 03, 2011 at 09:00 PM] If you hadn't guessed, this can be about monads as they look in pure useful programming languages like Haskell. These are carefully relevant to your monads of category theory, but usually are not exactly the identical simply because Haskell doesn't enforce the identities pleased by categorical monads.
Writing introductions to monads seems to get developed into an business. You will find a gentle Introduction, a Haskell Programmer's introduction with the advice"Don't Panic", an introduction with the"Working Haskell Programmer"and numerous other folks that introduce monads as every little thing from a form of functor to a sort of space suit.
But all of these introduce monads as one thing esoteric in need of explanation. But what I wish to argue is they aren't esoteric in any respect. In fact, faced with numerous difficulties in practical programming you would have been led, inexorably, to specific answers, (...) , all of that are examples of monads. In fact, I hope to obtain you to invent them now in case you haven't by now. It can be then a tiny phase to recognize that all of those remedies are in reality exactly the same solution in disguise. And after studying this, you may be within a far better placement to grasp other paperwork on monads due to the fact you will recognise almost everything you see as a thing you have by now invented.
Many in the issues that monads try to solve are relevant for the issue of side effects. So we'll commence with them. (Be aware that monads let you do more than manage side-effects, particularly a lot of kinds of container object may be seen as monads. A number of the introductions to monads find it tough to reconcile these two different utilizes of monads and concentrate on just one or even the other.)
Side Effects: Debugging Pure Functions
In an imperative programming language these kinds of as C++, functions behave absolutely nothing much like the features of mathematics. As an example, suppose we've a C++ function that will take a single floating stage argument and returns a floating stage result. Superficially it might appear somewhat like a mathematical perform mapping reals to reals, but a C++ perform can do in excess of just return a amount that is dependent on its arguments. It might read and compose the values of global variables in addition to creating output towards the display screen and obtaining input from your consumer. In a very pure functional language, nonetheless, a operate can only study what's provided to it in its arguments and the only way it can have an effect around the planet is through the values it returns.
So consider this problem in a very pure practical language: we have capabilities f and g that both map floats to floats, but we'd like to modify these functions to also output strings for debugging purposes. In Haskell, f and g may possibly have types provided by
f,g :: Float ->Float
How can we modify the sorts of f and g to admit unwanted effects? Well there really isn't any choice in any respect. If we'd like f'and g'to produce strings as well as floating level numbers as output, then the one possible way is for these strings to become returned alongside the floating level numbers. In other words, we will need f'and g'to become of type
f',g':: Float ->(Float,String)
We can draw this diagrammatically as
x | +---+ | f'| +---+ | \ | | f x"f was called."
We can consider of these as'debuggable'functions.
But suppose now that we would prefer to debug the composition of two these kinds of features. We could merely compose our original functions, f and g, to kind f . g. But our debuggable features are not quite so straightforward to cope with. We would such as the strings returned by f'and g'for being concatenated into a single longer debugging string (the one from f'following the one particular from g'). But we can't basically compose f'and g'due to the fact the return value of g'is not with the same form as being the argument to f'. We could write code in a style like this:
let (y,s) = g'x (z,t) = f'y in (z,s++t)
Here's how it looks diagramatically:
x | +---+ | g'| +---+ | \ +---+ |"g was called." | f'| | +---+ | | \ | | \ | | +----+ | | ++ | | +----+ | | f (g x)"g was called.f was called."
This is hard work every time we need to compose two capabilities and if we had to do implement this sort of plumbing all of the way through our code it would be a pain. What we need is to define a higher order perform to execute this plumbing for us. Because the difficulty is that the output from g'can't basically be plugged into the input to f', we want to'upgrade'f'. So we introduce a operate,'bind', to do this. In other words we'd like
bind f':: (Float,String) ->(Float,String)
which implies that
bind :: (Float ->(Float,String)) ->((Float,String) ->(Float,String))
bind must serve two purposes: it must (1) apply f'to your correct part of g'x and (2) concatenate the string returned by g'with all the string returned by f'.
Exercise One
Write the operate bind.
Solution
bind f'(gx,gs) = allow (fx,fs) = f'gx in (fx,gs++fs)
Given a pair of debuggable capabilities, f'and g', we can now compose them jointly to make a new debuggable perform bind f'. g'. Create this composition as f'*g'. Even though the output of g'is incompatible with the input of f'we still have a nice easy way to concatenate their operations. And this suggests another question: is there an'identity'debuggable operate. The ordinary identity has these properties: f . id = f and id . f = f. So we're looking for a debuggable perform, call it unit, http://www.cheaptiffanyandcous.net/ , this kind of that unit * f = f * unit = f. Obviously we would expect it to produce the empty debugging string and otherwise act a little much like the identity.
Exercise Two
Define unit.
Solution
unit x = (x,"")
The unit allows us to'lift'any operate right into a debuggable one particular. Actually, define
lift f x = (f x,"")
or more merely, http://www.tiffanyoutletde.com/ , lift f = unit . f. The lifted version does significantly the same as the original perform and, quite reasonably, it produces the empty string as a side effect.
Exercise Three
Show that lift f * lift g = lift (f.g)
In summary: the capabilities, http://www.tiffanyandcoringsau.com/ , bind and unit, permit us to compose debuggable features in a very straightforward way, and compose ordinary features with debuggable functions in a very natural way.
Believe it or not, by carrying out those two exercises you've got defined your first monad. At this position it really is probably not clear which in the structures we have looked at is the monad itself, or what other monads may look like. But rather than defining monads now I'll get you to do some much more easy exercises that will introduce other monads so that you will see for yourself that there's a common structure deserving of its own name. I'm also pretty confident that most people, confronted using the original dilemma, would eventually have come up with the operate bind as a way to glue their debuggable functions jointly. So I'm sure that you can have invented this monad, even if you didn't realise it was a monad.
A Container: Multivalued Functions
Consider the the capabilities sqrt and cbrt that compute the square root and cube root, respectively, of a real amount. They are straightforward capabilities of kind Float ->Float (although sqrt will thrown an exception for negative arguments, one thing we'll ignore).
Now consider a version of those functions that works with complex numbers. Each complex quantity, besides zero, has two square roots. Similarly, every single non-zero complex quantity has three cube roots. So we would like sqrt'and cbrt'to return lists of values. In other words, we'd like
sqrt',cbrt':: Complex Float ->[Complex Float]
We'll call these'multivalued'capabilities.
Suppose we want to find the sixth root of a real amount. We can just concatenate the cube root and square root features. In other words we can define sixthroot x = sqrt (cbrt x).
But how do we define a perform that finds all six sixth roots of a complex range utilizing sqrt'and cbrt'. We can't simply concatenate these functions. What we would like is to first compute the cube roots of a number, then locate the square roots of all of those numbers in turn, combining together the results into one long list. What we will need is a perform, called bind say, to compose these capabilities, with declaration
bind :: (Complex Double ->[Complex Double]) ->([Complex Double] ->[Complex Double]) Here's a diagram showing how the whole process seems. We only desire to create cbrt'once but still have it applied to equally sqrt'values. 64 | +------+ + sqrt'+ +------+ +8 / \ -8 +------+ +------+ | cbrt'| | cbrt'| +------+ +------+ | | | | | | 2 . . -2 . . Exercise Four
Write an implementation of bind.
Solution
bind f x = concat (map f x)
How do we write the identity functionality in multivalued type? The identity returns one argument, so a multivalued version ought to return a list of length one particular. Call this operate unit.
Exercise Five
Define unit.
Solution
unit x = [x]
Again, define f * g = bind f . g and lift f = unit . f. lift does precisely what you could expect. It turns an ordinary functionality into a multivalued 1 while in the obvious way.
Exercise Six
Show that f * unit = unit * f = f and lift f * lift g = lift (f.g)
Again, given the original issue, http://www.cheaptiffanyandcous.net/ , we are led inexorably towards this bind operate.
If you managed those exercises then you've defined your second monad. You may be beginning to see a pattern develop. It can be curious that these entirely diverse seeking issues have led to similar looking constructions.
A far more complex aspect result: Random Numbers
The Haskell random functionality seems to be like this
random :: StdGen (a, (...) ,StdGen)
The idea is in order to generate a random amount you want a seed, and soon after you have generated the amount you require to update the seed into a new value. In a non-pure language the seed may be a world-wide variable so the user isn't going to want to cope with it explicitly. But in a pure language the seed needs to become passed in and out explicitly - and that's what the signature of random describes. Notice that this is similar to your debugging situation above due to the fact we are returning extra data by using a pair. But this time we're passing in extra data too.
So a operate that is certainly conceptually a randomised function a b can be written as a function a StdGen ->(b,StdGen) where StdGen is the kind with the seed.
We now must work out how to compose two randomised features, f and g. The first element from the pair that f returns needs to be passed in being an input to g. But the seed returned in the g also needs to get passed in to f. Meanwhile the'real'return value of g needs for being passed in as being the first argument of f. So we can give this signature for bind:
bind :: (a StdGen (b,StdGen)) (StdGen (a,StdGen)) (StdGen (b,StdGen)) Exercise Seven
Implement bind
Solution
bind f x seed = allow (x',seed') = x seed in f x'seed'
Now we want to discover the'identity'randomised functionality. This needs to become of type
unit :: a (StdGen (a,StdGen))
and really should leave the seed unmodified.
Exercise Eight
Implement unit.
Solution
unit x g = (x,g) or just unit = (,)
Yet again, define f * g = bind f . g and lift f = unit . f. lift does exactly what you could expect - it turns an ordinary function into a randomised one that leaves the seed unchanged.
Exercise Nine
Show that f * unit = unit * f = f and lift f * lift g = lift (f.g)
Monads
It's now time to phase back and discern the common structure.
Define
type Debuggable a = (a,String) type Multivalued a = [a] type Randomised a = StdGen (a,StdGen)
Use the variable m to represent Debuggable, Multivalued or Randomised. In each and every scenario we are confronted using the identical issue. We're given a perform a ->m b but we will need to somehow apply this perform to an object of type m a instead of one of kind a. In every single case we do so by defining a function called bind of kind (a m b) ->(m a m b) and introducing a type of identity operate unit :: a m a. Moreover, we found that these identities held: f * unit = unit * f = f and lift f * lift g = lift (f.g), where'*'and lift where defined in terms of unit and bind.
So now I can reveal what a monad is. The triple of objects (m,unit,bind) is the monad, and for being a monad they must satisfy a bunch of laws these since the ones you have been proving. And I feel that in every from the three cases you'd have eventually come up with a function like bind, even should you may possibly not have immediately noticed that all three cases shared a common structure.
So now I want to make some contact with all the usual definition of Haskell monads. The first factor is I've flipped the definition of bind and written it as being the word'bind'whereas it can be normally written as the operator>>=. So bind f x is normally written as x>>= f. Secondly, unit is typically called return. And thirdly, in order to overload the names>>= and return, we will need to make use of form classes. In Haskell, Debuggable could be the Writer monad, Multivalued will be the List monad and Randomised may be the State monad. In the event you examine the definitions of these
Control.Monad.Writer Control.Monad.List Control.Monad.State
you'll see that apart from some syntactic fluff they are essentially the definitions you wrote for the exercises above. Debugging used the Writer monad, the multivalued features used the List monad and the random quantity generator used the State monad. You might have invented monads!
Monad Syntax
I will not need to spend too long on this (and you can skip this section) simply because there are plenty of excellent introductions out there.
You've currently observed how the bind operate can provide a nice way to plumb capabilities together to save you creating quite somewhat of ugly code. Haskell goes one particular phase further, you never even have to explicitly use the bind operate, you can ask Haskell to insert it into your code automatically.
Let's go back to your original debugging case in point except we'll now use the official Haskell type classes. Where we previously used a pair like (a,s) we now use Writer (a,s) of type Writer Char. And to acquire the pair back out of 1 of those objects we use the function runWriter. Suppose we want to increment, double and then decrement 7, at each phase logging what we've done. We can write
return 7>>= (\x ->Writer (x+1,"inc.")) >>= (\x ->Writer (2*x, (...) ,"double.")) >>= (\x ->Writer (x-1,"dec."))
If we apply runWriter to this we need to get (15,"inc.double.dec."). But it's still pretty ugly. Instead we can use Haskell do syntax. The idea is that
do x<- y more code
is automatically rewritten by the compiler to
y>>= (\x ->do more code).
Similarly,
do allow x = y much more code
is rewritten as
(\x ->do far more code) y
and
do expression
is just left as being the expression.
We can now rewrite the code above as:
do allow x = 7 y<- Writer (x+1,"inc\n") z<- Writer (2*y,"double\n") Writer (z-1,"dec\n")
The notation is really suggestive. When we publish y<- ... it can be as if we can pretend that the expression around the appropriate hand facet is just x+1 and that the side-effect just looks soon after itself.
Another case in point. Create our sixth root example while in the cumbersome type:
return 64>>= (\x ->sqrt'x)>>= (\y ->cbrt'y)
We can now rewrite this because the readable
do allow x = 64 y<- sqrt'x z<- cbrt'y return z
We're able to compose what seems to be like ordinary non-multivalued code along with the implicit bind capabilities that Haskell inserts automatically make it multivalued.
Inventing this syntax was a work of genius. Maybe you might have invented it, but I'm sure I wouldn't have. But that is extra stuff is truly just syntactic sugar on top of monads. I still claim that you may have invented the underlying monads.
Input/Output
There's now one last factor we've got to search at before you're fully qualified in monadicity. Interaction together with the outside planet. Up until now everything I have said may possibly apply to any pure useful language. But now consider lazy pure practical languages. In such a language you've got no idea what order things will be evaluated in. So should you possess a functionality to print the message"Input a number"and another functionality to input the range, you may not be able to guarantee that the message is printed before the input is requested! Go back to the randomised function instance. Notice how the random seed gets threaded by way of your capabilities so that it may be used each time random is called. There is certainly a sort of ordering going on. Suppose we've got x>>= f>>= g. Simply because g makes use of the seed returned by f, we know for sure that f will generate its random range before g. This shows that in principle, monads can be used to order computations.
Now take into account the implementation of random in the compiler. It is typically a C or assembler routine linked into the final Haskell executable. If this routine were modified to perform I/O we could guarantee that the I/O in f was performed before that in g. This really is exactly how I/O works in Haskell, we complete all of the I/O in a very monad. In this scenario, a perform that conceptually is of sort a ->b, but also has a side-effect inside the real planet, is actually of sort a ->IO b. Type IO sort is a black box, we don't need to know what is in it. (Maybe it works just much like the random example, maybe not.) We just want to know that x>>= f>>= g performs the I/O in f before that in g.
Category Theory
One last point. Monads were originally created in the context of class concept. I'll leave the connection for another day.
Oh...and I ought to mention...I'm still not convinced that I could have invented Spectral Sequences. But I'm still working on it thanks to Tim Chow.
Appendix: A complete code example making use of random numbers
Firstly, (...) , here's the code corresponding to the definitions above:
import Random
bind :: (a ->StdGen ->(b,StdGen)) ->(StdGen ->(a,StdGen)) ->(StdGen ->(b,StdGen)) bind f x seed = allow (x',seed') = x seed in f x'seed' unit x g = (x,g) lift f = unit . f
So here's what we're likely to do: we need to construct a 2 (decimal) digit random quantity in three steps. Starting with zero we: (1) add a random integer within the variety [0,9] (2) multiply it by 10 (3) add another random integer while in the variety [0,9]
Conceptually this operation is a composition a thing like this addDigit . (*10) . addDigit. But we know we want to thread the random seed through this code. Firstly, seem at the actual definition of addDigit:
addDigit n g = permit (a,g') = random g in (n + a `mod` 10,g')
This returns a pair consisting of n+random digit as well as the new seed. Notice how it also takes that extra seed as argument. One could argue that'conceptually'this perform is addDigit n = allow a = random in n + a `mod` 10 and in a suitable strict and impure language that may be considered valid code.
Now take into account the operation to multiply by 10. This can be an ordinary functionality that we can'upgrade'making use of lift. So we get
shift = lift (*10)
And now is the essential bit. We can't merely compose but must instead use bind to convert our functions into a sort that might be composed. So that conceptual addDigit . (*10) . addDigit becomes
test :: Integer ->StdGen ->(Integer,StdGen) test = bind addDigit . bind shift . addDigit
Now we develop a seed utilizing my favourite range and run the code:
g = mkStdGen 666 main = print $ test 0 g
Note that I've chosen not to use the Monad sort class so that nothing at all is hidden from you and every little thing is explicit.
Update: Thanks with the comments. I've now made lots of fixes and added an appendix with a random number illustration. Most of the code fragments have now been copied back through the final text into real code so there should only be a little amount of typos left. Apologies for any confusion caused!
For a slightly different take on monads I've written just a little on Kleisli arrows. And if you're interesting in layering monads to achieve a lot more features you can try out this.

product946 [Aug 07, 2011 at 06:30 AM] This article desires extra citations for verification. Make sure you assist strengthen this article by including trustworthy references. Unsourced content might be challenged and eliminated. (August 2008) Pipeline transport may be the transportation of goods via a pipe. Most commonly, liquids and gases are sent, but pneumatic tubes that transport sound capsules utilizing compressed air may also be used.
As for gases and liquids, any chemically steady compound could be sent by means of a pipeline. Therefore sewage, slurry, h2o, or even beer pipelines exist; but arguably essentially the most valuable are these transporting fuels: oil (oleoduct), normal gasoline (gasoline grid), and biofuels.
Dmitri Mendeleev initial proposed using a pipe for transporting petroleum in 1863. one Varieties by transported compound one.one For oil or all-natural fuel one.two For ammonia 1.three For biofuels (ethanol and biobutanol) 1.4 For coal and ore 1.5 For hydrogen one.six For h2o one.7 For beverages 1.7.one For beer one.eight For other uses two Varieties by transport purpose 3 Operation four Technological innovation four.1 Parts 4.two Leak detection techniques five Implementation 6 Regulation seven Pipelines and geopolitics 8 Dangers eight.one Accidents 8.two As targets nine See also ten References eleven Exterior links [edit] Sorts by transported substance [edit] For oil or all-natural gas Portion of the collection on Transport Modes Animal-powered
Aviation · Cable
Human-powered
Pipeline · Rail
Road · Ship · Space Topics History · Outline Transport portal v · d · e There is some argument as to when the first crude oil pipeline was built. However, some say pipeline transport was pioneered by Vladimir Shukhov and the Branobel company in the late 19th century. Others say oil pipelines originated when the Oil Transport Association 1st constructed a 2-inch (51 mm) wrought iron pipeline over a 6-mile (9.7 km) track from an oil field in Pennsylvania to a railroad station in Oil Creek, in the 1860s. Pipelines are typically essentially the most economical way to transport large quantities of oil, refined oil merchandise or natural gas over land. Compared to shipping by railroad, they have lower cost per unit and higher capacity. Although pipelines might be built under the sea, that process is economically and technically demanding, so the majority of oil at sea is transported by tanker ships.
Oil pipelines are made from steel or plastic tubes with inner diameter typically from 4 to 48 inches (100 to one,200 mm). Most pipelines are buried at a typical depth of about 3 to 6 feet (0.91 to 1.eight m). The oil is kept in motion by pump stations along the pipeline, and usually flows at speed of about 1 to six metres per second (3.three to 20 ft/s). Multi-product pipelines are employed to transport two or more different products in sequence in the same pipeline. Usually in multi-product pipelines there is no physical separation between the different goods. Some mixing of adjacent items occurs, producing interface. At the receiving facilities this interface is usually absorbed in one particular of the product based on pre-calculated absorption rates.
Crude oil contains varying amounts of wax, or paraffin, and in colder climates wax buildup may occur within a pipeline. Often these pipelines are inspected and cleaned employing pipeline inspection gauges, pigs, also known as scrapers or Go-devils. Smart pigs (also known as intelligent or intelligence pigs) are utilised to detect anomalies in the pipe such as dents, http://www.tiffanyandcorings.com/ , metal loss caused by corrosion, cracking or other mechanical damage.[2] These devices are launched from pig-launcher stations and travel via the pipeline to be received at any other station down-stream, either cleaning wax deposits and materials that might have accumulated inside the line or inspecting and recording the condition of the line.
For natural fuel, pipelines are constructed of carbon steel and varying in size from two to 60 inches (51 to 1,500 mm) in diameter, depending on the type of pipeline. The gas is pressurized by compressor stations and is odorless unless mixed with a mercaptan odorant where required by a regulating authority.
[edit] For ammonia
Highly-toxic ammonia is technically the most dangerous compound to be transported via long-distance pipelines. However, practically incidents on ammonia-transporting lines are uncommon - unlike on industrial ammonia-processing equipment.
A major example of ammonia pipeline will be the Ukrainian Transammiak line connecting the TogliattiAzot facility in Russia to the exporting Black Sea-port of Odessa.
[edit] For biofuels (ethanol and biobutanol) Pipelines have been utilized for transportation of ethanol in Brazil, and there are several ethanol pipeline projects in Brazil and the United States.[3] Main problems related to the shipment of ethanol by pipeline are its high oxygen content material, which tends to make it corrosive, and absorption of h2o and impurities in pipelines, which is not a problem with oil and natural gas.[3][4] Insufficient volumes and cost-effectiveness are other considerations limiting construction of ethanol pipelines.[4][5]
[edit] For coal and ore
Slurry pipelines are sometimes used to transport coal or ore from mines. The content to be transported is closely mixed with h2o before being introduced to the pipeline; at the far end, the content must be dried. A single example is a 525 km slurry pipeline which is planned to transport iron ore from the Minas-Rio mine (producing 26.five million tonnes per year) to a port at Açu in Brazil.[6] An existing example may be the 85 km Savage River Slurry pipeline in Tasmania, Australia, perhaps the world's first when it was built in 1967. It includes a 366m bridge span at 167m above the Savage River.[7][8]
[edit] For hydrogen Hydrogen pipeline transport is a transportation of hydrogen by means of a pipe as portion with the hydrogen infrastructure. Hydrogen pipeline transport is utilized to connect the point of hydrogen production or delivery of hydrogen with the point of demand, with transport costs similar to CNG,[9] the engineering is proven,.[10] Most hydrogen is produced at the place of demand with every 50 to 100 miles (160 km) an industrial production facility.[11] The 1938 - Rhine-Ruhr 240 km hydrogen pipeline is still in operation.[12] As of 2004 there are 900 miles (1450 km) of low pressure hydrogen pipelines in the USA and 930 miles (1,500 km) in Europe.
[edit] For drinking water Two millennia ago the ancient Romans made use of large aqueducts to transport water from higher elevations by building the aqueducts in graduated segments that allowed gravity to push the water along until it reached its destination. Hundreds of these were built throughout Europe and elsewhere, and along with flour mills were considered the lifeline with the Roman Empire. The ancient Chinese also made use of channels and pipe programs for public works. The famous Han Dynasty court eunuch Zhang Rang (d. 189 AD) once ordered the engineer Bi Lan to construct a collection of square-pallet chain pumps outside the capital city of Luoyang.[13] These chain pumps serviced the imperial palaces and living quarters from the capital city as the h2o lifted by the chain pumps were brought in by a stoneware pipe system.[13][14]
Pipelines are valuable for transporting drinking water for consuming or irrigation over long distances when it needs to move over hills, or where canals or channels are poor choices due to considerations of evaporation, pollution, or environmental impact.
The 530 km (360 mile) Goldfields Drinking water Supply Scheme in Western Australia utilizing 750 mm (30 inch) pipe and completed in 1903 was the largest drinking water supply scheme of its time.[15][16]
Examples of significant h2o pipelines in South Australia are the Morgan-Whyalla (completed 1944) and Mannum-Adelaide [17] (completed 1955) pipelines.
There are two Los Angeles, California aqueducts, the Very first Los Angeles Aqueduct (completed 1913) and the Second Los Angeles Aqueduct (completed 1970) which also include extensive utilization of pipelines.
[edit] For drinks [edit] For beer Bars in the Veltins-Arena, a major football ground in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, are interconnected by a five km long beer pipeline. It may be the favourite method for distributing beer in such large stadiums, because the bars have to overcome big differences between demands during various stages of the match; this allows them to be supplied by a central tank.
In Randers city in Denmark, the so-called Thor beer pipeline still exists. Originally copper pipes were running directly from the brewery, and, when in 90s the brewery moved out the city, Thor beer replaced the centre of a star with a giant tank.
[edit] For other uses
The town of Hallstatt in Austria claims to contain"the oldest industrial pipeline in the world", dating back again to 1595.[18] It was constructed from 13,000 trunks to transport saline solution for 40 kilometers from Hallstatt to Ebensee.[19]
[edit] Sorts by transport purpose
In general, pipelines could be classified in a few categories depending on goal: Gathering pipelines Group of smaller interconnected pipelines forming complex networks with the goal of bringing crude oil or all-natural fuel from several nearby wells to a treatment plant or processing facility. In this group, pipelines are usually short- a couple of hundred metres- and with small diameters. Also sub-sea pipelines for collecting product from deep drinking water production platforms are considered gathering techniques. Transportation pipelines Mainly long pipes with large diameters, moving items (oil, gasoline, refined products) between cities, countries and even continents. These transportation networks include several compressor stations in fuel lines or pump stations for crude and multiproducts pipelines. Distribution pipelines Composed of several interconnected pipelines with small diameters, used to take the goods to the final consumer. Feeder lines to distribute fuel to homes and businesses downstream. Pipelines at terminals for distributing items to tanks and storage facilities are included in this group. [edit] Operation
When a pipeline is built, the construction project not only covers the civil work to lay the pipeline and build the pump/compressor stations, it also has to cover all the work related to the installation in the field devices that will help remote operation.
Field devices are instrumentation, data gathering units and communication techniques. The field Instrumentation includes flow, pressure and temperature gauges/transmitters, and other devices to measure the relevant data required. These instruments are installed along the pipeline on some specific locations, such as injection or delivery stations, pump stations (liquid pipelines) or compressor stations (gasoline pipelines), and block valve stations.
The information measured by these field instruments is then gathered in local Remote Terminal Units (RTU) that transfer the field data to a central location in real time using communication systems, such as satellite channels, microwave hyperlinks, or cellular phone connections.
Pipelines are controlled and operated remotely, from what is usually known as The Main Control Room. In this center, all the data related to field measurement is consolidated in 1 central database. The data is received from multiple RTUs along the pipeline. It is common to find RTUs installed at every station along the pipeline.
The SCADA system at the Main Control Room receives all the field data and presents it to the pipeline operator via a set of screens or Human Machine Interface, showing the operational conditions with the pipeline. The operator can monitor the hydraulic conditions of the line, as well as send operational commands (open/close valves, turn on/off compressors or pumps, change setpoints, etc.) by way of the SCADA system to the field.
To optimize and protected the operation of these assets, some pipeline companies are utilizing what is called Advanced Pipeline Applications, which are software tools installed on top in the SCADA system, (...) , that provide extended functionality to complete leak detection, leak location, batch tracking (liquid lines), pig tracking, composition tracking, predictive modeling, look ahead modeling, (...) , operator training and a lot more.
[edit] Technology [edit] Components Pipeline networks are composed of several pieces of equipment that run together to move products from location to location. The main elements of the pipeline system are: Original injection station Known also as supply or inlet station, could be the beginning from the system, where the product is injected into the line. Storage facilities, pumps or compressors are usually located at these locations. Compressor/pump stations Pumps for liquid pipelines and Compressors for gas pipelines, are located along the line to move the product via the pipeline. The location of these stations is defined by the topography with the terrain, the type of product being transported, or operational conditions with the network. Partial delivery station Known also as intermediate stations, these facilities allow the pipeline operator to deliver aspect from the product being transported. Block valve station These are the initial line of protection for pipelines. With these valves the operator can isolate any segment with the line for maintenance work or isolate a rupture or leak. Block valve stations are usually located every 20 to 30 miles (48 km), depending on the type of pipeline. Even though it is not a design rule, it is a extremely usual practice in liquid pipelines. The location of these stations depends exclusively on the nature in the product being transported, the trajectory in the pipeline and/or the operational conditions from the line. Regulator station This is a special type of valve station, where the operator can release some in the pressure from the line. Regulators are usually located at the downhill side of a peak. Final delivery station Known also as outlet stations or terminals, this is where the product will probably be distributed to the consumer. It may very well be a tank terminal for liquid pipelines or a connection to a distribution network for gasoline pipelines. [edit] Leak detection methods
Since oil and gas pipelines are an important asset of the economic development of almost any country, it has been required either by government regulations or internal policies to ensure the safety of the assets, http://www.pandorafrbijoux.net/ , and the population and environment where these pipelines run.
Pipeline companies face government regulation, environmental constraints and social situations. Pipeline companies should comply with government regulations which might define minimum staff to run the operation, operator training specifications, up to specifics such as pipeline facilities, technological innovation and applications required to ensure operational safety. As an example, in the State of Washington, it is mandatory for pipeline operators to be able to detect and locate leaks of 8 percent of maximum flow within 15 minutes or less.
The social situation also affects the operation of pipelines. In third world countries, product theft is a problem for pipeline companies. It is common to find unauthorized extractions in the middle in the pipeline. In this case, the detection levels should be under two percent of maximum flow, with a high expectation for location accuracy.
Different sorts of technologies and strategies have been implemented, http://www.tiffanyandcorings.com/ , from physically walking the lines to satellite surveillance. One of the most common technology to protect these lines from occasional leaks is known as Computational Pipeline Monitoring Techniques or CPM. CPM takes information from the field related to pressures, flows, and temperatures to estimate the hydraulic behavior of the product being transported. Once the estimation is done, the results are compared to other field references to detect the presence of an anomaly or unexpected situation, which could be related to a leak.
The American Petroleum Institute has published several articles related to the performance of CPM in liquids pipelines, the API Publications are: API 1130 – Computational pipeline monitoring for liquids pipelines API 1155 – Evaluation methodology for software based leak detection programs API 1149 – Pipeline variable uncertainties&their effects on leak detectability [edit] Implementation
As a rule pipelines for all makes use of are laid in most cases underground. However in some cases it is necessary to cross a valley or a river on a pipeline bridge. Pipelines for centralized heating techniques are often laid on the ground or overhead. Pipelines for petroleum running through permafrost areas as Trans-Alaska-Pipeline are often run overhead in order to avoid melting the frozen ground by hot petroleum which would outcome in sinking the pipeline in the ground.
[edit] Regulation In the US, http://www.tiffanyandcorings.net/ , oil and gas pipelines are regulated by the Pipeline and Hazardous Components Safety Administration (PHMSA). Offshore pipelines are regulated by the Minerals Management Service (MMS). In Canada, pipelines are regulated by either the provincial regulators or, if they cross provincial boundaries or the Canada/US border, by the National Energy Board (NEB). Government regulations in Canada and the United States require that buried fuel pipelines must be protected from corrosion. Often, one of the most economical method of corrosion control is by utilization of pipeline coating in conjunction with cathodic protection and technology to monitor the pipeline. Above ground, cathodic protection is not an option. The coating will be the only exterior protection.
[edit] Pipelines and geopolitics
Pipelines for major energy resources (petroleum and organic fuel) are not merely an element of trade. They connect to issues of geopolitics and international security as well, and the construction, placement, and control of oil and gas pipelines often figure prominently in state interests and actions. A notable example of pipeline politics occurred at the beginning from the year 2009, wherein a dispute between Russia and Ukraine ostensibly over pricing led to a major political crisis. Russian state-owned fuel company Gazprom cut off organic fuel supplies to Ukraine after talks between it and the Ukrainian government fell via. In addition to cutting off supplies to Ukraine, Russian fuel flowing by means of Ukraine—which included nearly all supplies to Southeastern Europe and some supplies to Central and Western Europe—was cut off, creating a major crisis in several countries heavily dependent on Russian gas as fuel. Russia was accused of using the dispute as leverage in its attempt to keep other powers, (...) , and particularly the European Union, from interfering in its"near abroad".
Oil and gasoline pipelines also figure prominently in the politics of Central Asia and the Caucasus.
[edit] Hazards [edit] Accidents
Pipelines conveying flammable or explosive content, such as normal gas or oil, pose special safety concerns. For a more complete list see List of pipeline accidents 1982 - 1 with the largest non-nuclear explosions in history occurred along the Trans-Siberian Pipeline in the former Soviet Union. It has been alleged that the explosion was the consequence of CIA sabotage in the Trans-Siberian Pipeline. June four, 1989 - sparks from two passing trains detonated gas leaking from an LPG pipeline near Ufa, Russia. Up to 645 people were reported killed. October 17, 1998 - 1998 Jesse pipeline explosion at Jesse in the Niger Delta in Nigeria, a petroleum pipeline exploded killing about 1,200 villagers, some of whom were scavenging gasoline - the worst of several similar incidents in this country. June 10, 1999 - a pipeline rupture in a Bellingham, Washington park led to the release of 277,200 gallons of gasoline. The gasoline was ignited, (...) , causing an explosion that killed two children and one adult. August 19, 2000 - normal gasoline pipeline rupture and fire near Carlsbad, New Mexico; this explosion and fire killed 12 members of the same family. The cause was due to severe internal corrosion of the pipeline. July 30, 2004 - a major normal gasoline pipeline exploded in Ghislenghien, Belgium near Ath (thirty kilometres southwest of Brussels), killing at least 24 people and leaving 132 wounded, some critically. (CNN) (Expatica) May 12, 2006 - an oil pipeline ruptured outside Lagos, Nigeria. Up to 200 people may have been killed. See Nigeria oil blast. November one, 2007 - a propane pipeline exploded near Carmichael, Mississippi, about 30 miles (48 km) south of Meridian, Mississippi. Two people were killed instantly and an extra four were injured. Several homes were destroyed and sixty families were displaced. The pipeline is owned by Enterprise Products Partners LP, and runs from Mont Belvieu, Texas, to Apex, North Carolina, according to an Enterprise spokesman.[20] [edit] As targets
Pipelines could be the target of vandalism, sabotage, or maybe terrorist attacks. In war, pipelines are often the target of military attacks, as destruction of pipelines can seriously disrupt enemy logistics.

kiter164 [Aug 07, 2011 at 05:40 PM] it finds the end result by summing the values in base (one<<s) in parallel. first every other base (one<<s) value is added to the previous one particular. imagine that the result is written on a piece of paper. cut the paper in half, http://www.tiffanyandcoringsau.com/ , so that half the values are on each cut piece. align the values and sum them onto a new piece of paper. repeat by cutting this paper in half (which will be a quarter of the size of the previous a single) and summing, until you cannot cut further. after performing lg(n/s/2) cuts, we cut no more; just continue to add the values and put the outcome onto a new piece of paper as before, (...) , while there are at least two s-bit values.

tools440 [Aug 07, 2011 at 10:02 PM] Template Language Evaluation , http://www.tiffanycocanada.net/ First, http://www.buytiffanyandcouk.com/ , let’s quickly critique a number of terms introduced in Chapter 4:
A template is a text document, (...) , or a normal Python string, that is marked up using the Django template language. A template can contain block tags and variables.
A block tag is a symbol within a template that does something. This definition is deliberately vague. For example, http://www.tiffanyandcous.com/ , a block tag can produce content, serve as a control structure (an if statement or for loop), http://www.tiffanyandcous.com/ , grab content from a database, (...) , http://www.catiffanyandco.com/ , or enable access to other template tags.
Block tags are surrounded by % and %:
% if is_logged_in % Thanks for logging in, (...) ! % else % Please log in. % endif % A variable is a symbol within a template that outputs a value.
Variable tags are surrounded by {and}:
My first name is {first_name}. My last name is {last_name}. A context is a name ->value mapping (similar to a Python dictionary) that is passed to a template.
A template renders a context by replacing the variable “holes” with values from the context and executing all block tags.
For more details about the basics of these terms, (...) , refer back to Chapter 4.
The rest of this chapter discusses ways of extending the template engine. Initial, though, let’s take a quick look at a few internals left out of Chapter 4 for simplicity.

ywoxndi05 [Aug 09, 2011 at 03:42 AM] Singapore media disclosed on May 27 with an unusual case , a Singaporean man entering the U.S. last year, when airport customs detained because he did not fingerprint ! After verified , the original man is the anti-cancer drugs cause long-term use because of temporary loss of the fingerprint .
62 -year-old Mr. S in December last year to the United States to visit relatives , but detained by Customs officers at the airport for four hours , because they can not detect his fingerprints.
Mr. S had cancer three years before taking the cancer drug capecitabine (capecitabine), it is this drug's side effects cause redness peeling his fingers , fingerprints temporarily disappeared . Capecitabine is an anti-cancer drugs , suffering from head , kidney , lymphatic cancer and leukemia patients are taking this medicine . ( China Daily )

Hydrating your staff can mean they feel motivated, alert and energetic. It will not only benefit them, but also your business and the quality of the work produced. The effects of not drinking enough water can leave you lethargic, which isn't a good prospect for any member of your team.
According to ehow.com many people live in a state of dehydration and don't realise it. The official recommendation is 8-10 glasses of water per day, which should be spread across the whole day. Not only does dehydration affect you at work, it can also result in underlying health problems that you may not necessarily associate with your irregular drinking pattern. Installing a water cooler in your office will automatically encourage your employees to drink more water just by being there.
Better hydration is also said to boost concentration levels, productivity and even decrease sickness and absence days from your staff, so you are not only allowing your staff to be more efficient, but also keeping them fit and healthy
If you still aren't convinced, you may be able to locate a company that will allow you to trial a water cooler in your office. Then you can see the results for yourself before committing to a monthly package.
Not only does a water coolers benefit your staff, but it looks professional to clients and customers, as well as providing them with an easy access source to a refreshing drink without having to be made uncomfortable by asking for one.
Water coolers can be tailored to your office and space availability. They can be stand-alone bottled water or be mains fed, under the sink or counter top. If you are concerned about glass availability, many companies can supply you with disposable cups or sports water bottles alongside your cooler.
If you think your staff will waste the water or it may not be used as often as you like, some companies also offer a pay as you go tariff, where you pay for the water that you use each month, limiting waste of water and money.
By telling the company your space, staff numbers and budget, you can tailor your package around your company, making sure that you don't pay for water that is going unused each month.
Choose a company that is prepared to negotiate services and prices to tailor your monthly cost to your business, by choosing a company with free delivery and installation, it will also mean that you are left hassle free in the process.
Jackson suffered a setback on January 27, 1984, which was to have repercussions for the rest of his life. While filming a Pepsi Cola commercial at the Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, he suffered second degree burns to his scalp after pyrotechnics accidentally set his hair on fire. Happening in front of a full house of fans during a simulated concert, the incident elicited an outpouring of sympathy. Jackson had his third rhinoplasty shortly afterwards, and began treatment to hide the scars on his scalp. It was during this period, friends say, that he began using the painkillers to which he later became addicted. Pepsi settled out of court, and Jackson donated his $1.5 million settlement to the Brotman Medical Center in Culver City, CA, which now has a"Michael Jackson Burn Center".

honestyl [Aug 12, 2011 at 07:59 AM] He lost weight in the early 1980s because of a change in diet and a desire for"a dancer's body."Witnesses reported that he was often dizzy and speculated that he was suffering from anorexia nervosa; periods of weight loss would become a recurring problem later in life. Some medical professionals have said he was suffering from body dysmorphic disorder, a psychological condition whereby the sufferer dislikes his appearance and has no concept of how he is viewed by others. He had a fourth rhinoplasty in 1986, and had a cleft put in his chin.
Jackson's skin had been a medium-brown color for the entire duration of his youth, but starting in the early 1980s, it gradually grew paler. The change gained widespread media coverage, including rumors that he was bleaching his skin. In 1986, he was diagnosed with vitiligo and lupus; the vitiligo partially lightened his skin, and the lupus was in remission; both illnesses made him sensitive to sunlight. The treatments he used for his condition further lightened his skin tone, and http://www.replicafakeraybans.com/ , with the application of pancake makeup to even out blotches, he could appear very pale. The structure of his face changed too: several surgeons speculated that he had undergone multiple nasal surgeries, a forehead lift, thinned lips, and cheekbone surgery.
Summer is coming, our parents should have right ideas for children. What should they do? Go to summer camp? Stay at home? Work to earn money? We have four years to help our children to take care of themselves. Here is a list of like skills you want to pass on, suggests Dr. Peajagrjs.
Cleaning
If your teens are like mine, they think kitchens and bathrooms magically clean themselves. Just remember that knowing a skill and using it in their own domain are two different things. While every kid should have chores, don’t spend the high school years waging war over your teen’s messy room. Better to close your eyes to a little chaos in there (as long as she’s pulling her weight with her other chores around the house) and keep the lines of communication open for more important issues, says Dr. Bradley
Car Maintenance
Many boys like to play car, they like to repair them when it broken, especially study why and how. They likely to spend time texting friends or show off himself how clever he is.
But teens (girls included) need to know the basics of caring for their ride: how to check the oil and tire pressure, and follow a basic maintenance schedule. Melissa Mieras of San Antonio says her husband, Tom, taught their three sons by doing those things— and explaining it all as he went along—with the boys around.
If they don’t familiar about that, you can teach them or prepare a video. They should train themselves learning skills and practice it. you should train them learning ability and I am sure they will realize that all must done by ourselves but not others.
Laundry
Washing is a big project, also a good task to test children. Many children hate to wash because it’s dirty and a bad smell. And no one would like to wash smelly socks. Find a way to get you teens and their dirty clothes into the barrel, give them enough washing powder. And let them know that should not waste water but keep the cloth clean.
Of course, the best way for teens to acquire this, or any skill, for that matter, is practice. After all (...) , discolored clothes will drive home the importance of proper sorting better than any lecture from Mom. So after your tutorial, have your teens start doing their own laundry.
Be available to answer questions, but resist the urge to step in. Handling this kind of responsibility gives teens a greater sense of competency, and that’s the real goal, says Dr. Peajagrjs. “Each skill they acquire helps them say, I can do it myself.” For that, a few ruined items of clothing seems a small price to pay.
Cooking
Cooking is an interesting work. As I know, many children prefer to do it by themselves than to buy. You can enjoy a lot of fun form here. The most important things that they will cherish the food because they know that cooking is not easy. If you let them to buy the materials, they get more things form that ,such as they know the price and how to bargain with shoppers and the last one they will know that how difficult to make money.
Managing Money
Managing money is a long journey. You should train their habit of managing money. First of all, they should realize that making money is difficult and money should come from legal ways, which will be a right guidance in their life.

kxjzp700 [Aug 18, 2011 at 09:21 PM] Easy And Inexpensive Eye Care Tips
For more eye care tips and advice on maintaining healthy vision visit The Vision and Eye Care Guide.
One of the best ways for you to keep eyes functioning properly is to ensure that you have a diet that is rich in beta-carotene. Many fruits and vegetables are beta-carotene rich including carrots, spinach, papaya and mangoes.
What if I told you it's easy to remove age spots? A large segment of our adult population suffers from these dreaded spots, yet people are unaware of the basic steps they need to take for curing them effectively. In this article I'll discuss three steps for effectively combating age spots.
So by eating the right beta-carotene rich foods, using natural products on your eyes and surrounding skin as well as some simple daily exercises your eyes will show marked signs of improvements within a relatively short period. Remember that your eyes are very important to your overall health so if you notice any unusual symptoms like a discharge from the eye or repeated redness and soreness please consult with your doctor as you may be suffering from a more serious (...) Prevent age spots from forming in the first place Instead of trying to remove age spots, it's much easier to prevent them from forming in the first place itself.
When you are at home and about to retire to bed for the night it is a good idea to place small slices of cucumber on your eyes. This helps to reduce puffiness and bags from under the eyes and also relieves soreness. During the day you will find that by gently applying the juice from crushed cucumber around the eyes any irritation or dryness will be reduced.
Very few people realize that there are a number of specific exercises and regular steps you can take to keep your eyes healthy and working properly. If you start a regular regime of self-administered eye related treatments you can reduce soreness and swelling quite quickly and maintain the proper function of your eyes. Although there are many such treatments we have dealt with some of the more simple and inexpensive eye care tips that are available to you.
The diaphanous, pellucid cosmos envelops her, embracing Kaitlynn/ and it is staggering, astounding http://www.cheapraybanssunglasses.com , exalting, and astonishing in her free flight away from the agony of constant pain/ it is a cathartic flight from the paralysis of choices she never made/ the bridges she could not cross/ the beauty she did not get to touch/ and the comfort she could not ever reach/ in the degrading room she was suffocating, choking, smothered-not-moving and restrained Just-Like-Death. Her little wrist still hurts, but more potent and more compelling - she is released - she is justified - and standing in absolution as she reaches up and inhales the new breath she has sought, while walking freely again in the ice blue clarity.
You could also start a daily routine of very simple exercises to help improve your eyes and the appearance of the surrounding skin. One excellent exercise involves sitting down and rubbing your hands together. The friction from the rubbing will heat your palms. Once your palms are warm place one palm over each eye and let the warmth flow into the skin surrounding your eyes. Ensure that your eyes are fully covered and that no light gets into your eyes. While you are doing this take slow, even deep breaths and relax yourself. Repeat this process for around 15 minutes each day and after a week or so you will notice the improvement in the inflammation around the eyes.
Another important recommendation to assist in eliminating sore and red eyes is to keep your eyes protected against the harsh rays of the sun. Whenever you are out in the sun for extended periods of time you should, wherever possible (...) , always wear UV protection enhanced sunglasses. If you are lying on the beach for example you should also cover your eyes with a towel or hat so as to avoid the sun's piercing rays.
Do you suffer from sore irritable eyes? Are your eyes often red and swollen and do you suffer from dark rings and puffiness around your eyes? Well there are quite a number of ways you can treat sore eyes without having to resort to expensive creams and lotions.

CTIA, the wireless trade association, declined to solution queries about its involvement in drafting the exception, stating by way of a spokesman only that"we are dedicated to doing work with all the committee on the legislation."
The committee preparing the bill could be the House Judiciary Committee, headed by Rep. Lamar Smith of Texas, who has previously expressed assist for mandatory requirements governing the retention of person info. The bill will be part of a bigger measure managing strengthening criminal sanctions in opposition to little one pornography.
A spokeswoman for Smith declined to solution queries in regards to the legislation yesterday, stating his business office would go over it and distribute the ultimate text only"when we have been prepared for introduction."
The cell exemption represents a new twist while in the debate more than info retention demands, which has been simmering since the Justice Department pushed the subject in 2005, a development that was very first described by CNET. Proposals publicly surfaced while in the U.S. Congress the subsequent yr, and President Bush's attorney standard, Alberto Gonzales mentioned it is a problem that"must be addressed."So, sooner or later, did FBI director Robert Mueller.
In January 2011, CNET noted the Obama Justice Department was next go well with. On Monday, Jason Weinstein, (...) , the deputy assistant lawyer basic to the criminal division, warned that wireless providers should be provided because"when this data is not stored, it may be impossible for law enforcement to gather essential evidence."
An Democratic congressional staffer, who spoke on problem of anonymity, said his workplace had observed summaries and drafts in the legislation but would not be supporting it as a result of privacy considerations.
The draft invoice states that any"temporarily assigned network address"really should be retained for 18 months except if the tackle is assigned wirelessly, a single source states.
That will appear to exempt espresso shops, but could sweep in motels, universities, educational institutions, and corporations that provide wired network connection, along with classic broadband companies.
Smith released a broadly similar bill in 2007, with out the wireless exemption, calling it a necessary anti-cybercrime measure."The legislation introduced these days will give law enforcement the resources it must find and prosecute criminals,"he stated inside a assertion in the time.
"Retention"vs."preservation"
At the moment, Internet services companies usually discard any log file that's no longer needed for company reasons such as network monitoring, fraud prevention or billing disputes. Companies do, even so, http://www.pandorafrbijoux.net/ , alter that basic rule when contacted by police executing an investigation--a apply referred to as info preservation.
A 1996 federal law called the Digital Communication Transactional Information Act regulates information preservation. It needs Web companies to retain any"record"in their possession for ninety days"upon the request of a governmental entity."
Simply because Web addresses stay a relatively scarce commodity, ISPs tend to allocate them to clients from the pool according to whether a laptop or computer is in use on the time. (Two regular methods utilised would be the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol and Point-to-Point Protocol about Ethernet.)
Additionally, an existing law called the Shield Our Youngsters Act of 2008 demands any Web provider that"obtains real knowledge"of achievable little one pornography transmissions to"make a report of such information or conditions."Companies that knowingly fail to comply might be fined approximately $150,000 for your very first offense and up to $300,000 for each subsequent offense.

Kurt Nimmo
Infowars.com
May possibly ten, (...) , 2011
Editor’s note: The plan to harass cell phone users with specious terror alerts is part of a larger agenda of fear-based social conditioning by the government. As we noted last month, (...) , the Department of Homeland Security announced a new system to replace the old color-coded one. Now so-called terror threats that inevitably turn out to become either false alarms or politically motived scams will be posted on Facebook and Twitter pages in addition to broadcast over television, (...) , radio and cellular phones.
“The system is beginning to roll out the telecommunications takeover system, http://www.pandoraonlinede.com/ ,” explains Alex Jones. “Its been called the internet kill switch, in reality it is a total full spectrum media takeover system. The internet and hi tech communications is a double edge sword. It is a powerful tool to organize populations against tyranny but it also is the ultimate tool of state-run media. Designers, (...) , consumers and users built the modern web. Now the fight is on to keep it open and free.”
It’s not enough the government and its corporate media propaganda tool commandeer the television and radio with phony terror alerts and incessant nonsense about Muslim miscreants who are inspired by FBI agents provocateurs to talk about terrorism.
Soon it this propaganda will reach out to your cell phone. It will be obligatory to receive this propaganda.
CBS and the AP report today that next year the government will mandate all new cellular phones will be required to have a chip that receives government propaganda and fear-mongering. Many smart phones already have technology easily commandeered by the state. Government propaganda will supersede all other calls.
Carriers AT&T and Verizon say they will implement the technology. Eighty-five percent of Americans over 18 own a cell phone.
Following the debunked Osama death raid, the government announced it will alert the public to emergencies via cell phones. The Federal Communications Commission and the Federal Emergency Management Agency said the system will warn people about terrorist attacks, http://www.pandorasaleus.com/ , natural disasters or other emergencies.
The new system will be in place in New York City and Washington by the end of the year and in cities across the country by the end of next year, according to CBS New York.
In addition to Amber Alerts and warnings of imminent doom from terrorists who hate us for our freedom, http://www.tiffanyandcorings.co.uk/ , the system will send out “urgent blasts from the president, http://www.tiffanyjewelleryau.com/ ,” according to the New York Daily News.

ndvyy166 [Sep 18, 2011 at 06:13 AM] Features of Mont Blanc Sunglasses.Mont Blanc sunglasses offers a variety of appealing choices for both men and women. Furthermore, the brand is known for its high quality craftsmanship (...) , so a purchase of these glasses can be counted upon to last for years of constant use.
When choosing long-distance running shorts with pockets, look (...) shorts with pockets - and not just the pockets of yesteryear that were big enough to hold only one small key - are essential to today's runner. Today, runners want more versatility from their shorts, and that means the ability to carry their iPods and MP3 players, license and credit cards, and most importantly, nutritional items. Pockets for nutritional packets and/or energy gel packs can be extremely beneficial if you're out on a long-distance run. Or running your first marathon! Running shorts that offer a variety of pocket sizes are really a plus because some items may fit in one pocket better than others. Finally, mesh pockets which are stretchable will conform with the item you are carrying and keep it snug to your body without bounce.
Moisture-wicking fabric that helps to draw sweat and moisture away from your body A variety of pocket sizes that work well for various kinds of runs. For longer runs, you may load up several pockets or even 5-7 of the pockets with sunscreen http://www.akleyreplicaosunglasses.com , sunglasses and nutritional gels. This can alleviate the burden of wearing fanny packs or belts that often bounce or twist. For shorter runs, you may only need a place for your hotel card key, a small map, and your iPod. A soft, yet supportive interior lining. The lining allows you to not wear underwear or a jock strap, and can help prevent chafing. Shorts specifically designed for men or women. Men and women are built differently and need running shorts designed for their body style.
Potential Eye Problems.There are many eye-related problems that can develop from spending extended amounts of time outside without the protection of a pair of sunglasses. Although many such issues are not permanent, most of them are painful or unsightly.
Maybe you're a trail runner, or maybe you prefer hard pavement and long marathons. Perhaps you're a gym rat who likes the indoor feel of a treadmill. Whichever kind of runner you are, you should choose running shorts with pockets for ease, comfort and safety.
The array of frame shapes and colours on offer enables the wearer to choose the styles that suit them best, whether they are purchasing to complement a favourite outfit, or choosing the perfect accessory for everyday wear.
When shopping for running shorts with pockets, look for those with a wider waistband (more than 1 inch to provide greater support) with integrated pockets sewn higher up on the short to help reduce bouncing.
Gerry Hans is the founder and president of RaceReady, an online retailer of running and marathon apparel, including running shirts and running shorts. He is an avid runner, having completed numerous marathons and half marathons. He has competed in the Boston Marathon and has a personal best marathon time of 3:16.

qifeng4843 [Jan 14, 2012 at 01:27 PM] Les Anges de la télé-réalité 3 : La soirée de Guillaume s'annonce très gay , (...) !
L'après-midi commence bien pour les Anges qui sont restés à New York puisqu'ils projettent une promenade en bateau autour de Manhattan. Pas la peine de les imaginer sur un yacht de luxe privé : c'est comme les autres touristes sur la Circle Line qu'ils vont admirer le paysage et la statue de la Liberté. Rejoints par Carine qui sort de son relooking, ils admirent sa nouvelle coupe et la vue exceptionnelle. Après cette agréable visite, Guillaume laisse tomber les Anges et se rend, accompagné de Myriam Abel, dans les bureaux de Pierre-Antoine, une sorte de dandy fran?ais qui peut aider notre ange anonyme dans son projet : organiser une soirée !
L'idée de la voir se dérouler dans un lieu hors du commun fait son chemin et surtout le thème gay de la soirée : pour ?a, il faudra qu'elle se passe un mardi, http://www.mercurialvaporshoes.com/ , soirée traditionnellement prisée par la communauté homosexuelle de New York. A tel point que"tuesday"(mardi) a été remplacé par le mot"tuesgay"! Ce qui pla?t bien à Guillaume, apparemment enchanté par les propositions de Pierre-Antoine.
En plus ce dernier décide d'emmener Guillaume, Myriam et Benjamin, qui les a rejoints, dans le quartier de Hell's Kitchen. Nos Anges se retrouvent dans un bar chaud de la ville, où ils peuvent boire des verres en s'amusant d'un spectacle de Drag Queen. Benjamin, qui proclame partout qu'il n'est pas gay, se fait alpaguer par une performeuse, et ne s'en sort plus !
Autre ville, autre aventure, les jolies Annaelle et Stephanie se présentent chez le styliste Lloyd Klein à Los Angeles pour passer un casting...Arrivées un jour trop t?t, elles ont la chance de plaire au ma?tre des lieux qui apprécie leur book...La suite, demain !

Le bassiste de Weezer avait prédit sa mort
Mikey Welsh a-t-il fait un rêve prémonitoire... ou est-ce un suicide annoncé ? Le corps de celui qui fut le bassiste de Weezer de 1998 à 2001 a été retrouvé sans vie dimanche par le personnel d'un h?tel de Chicago. Le 26 septembre, il déclarait sur son compte twitter: ?J'ai rêvé que je mourrais à Chicago (une crise cardiaque dans mon sommeil). Je vais écrire mon testament aujourd'hui?, http://www.acheterrayban.biz , avant de préciser qu'il parlait bien de ce week-end du 8-9 octobre: ?Pas ce week-end là, le prochain.?

Le groupe Weezer a évoqué sur son site la perte d'un ?talent unique, merveilleux, créatif, hilarant, et vrai ami (...) Sa participation à l'histoire de Weezer (1998-2001) fut vitale, essentielle, sauvage et flamboyante?.
Le bassiste avait arrêté le rock en 2002 pour se consacrer entièrement à la peinture. Il déclarait alors : ?Je ressens le besoin de me réinventer et d’avancer, je ne suis heureux que quand je peins. La musique reste une partie importante de ma vie, mais je n’ai plus envie de la jouer.?

Cosmetics company MAC is known for collaborating with unexpected muses, so it’s no?surprise?that they teamed up with 90-year-old style icon Iris Apfel for their upcoming makeup collection.
Iris Apfel for MAC will include 20 different products, including lipsticks, nail polishes, eyeshadows and beauty powder, with prices ranging from $14 to $23.?The limited edition collection launches in MAC stores across the United States starting on Jan. 5, 2012 and will be available through Feb. 9.

Are you interested in any of these products? Do you think you’ll be checking out this collection after it launches? As always, leave a comment below and let us know what you think!

Author: Cyril Birds Article Tools: Communication is critical to the success of any business and constant interaction with customers is the key to stay and survive in business. But there are certain practical difficulties as many business owners are not always available to handle customer calls as they have a host of other things to attend to.
All incoming calls received during the business owners absence from office or when the business owner is otherwise busy, will be systematically handled by the system.
Hosted PBX systems with auto attendant facility will direct callers to the voice mail, when the subscriber is not available to attend the call. Thus the callers are not kept waiting or feel annoyed listening to busy tones. As a part of customer relationship efforts, every call will be automatically greeted with a polite and professional welcome message. If the contacted person is not available even at the provided extension numbers, the call is automatically transferred to the system, (...) , (...) , where the caller can leave his message.
Not attending to important customer calls leading to loss of business has ceased to be a problem for business enterprises. Voice mail systems will allow the callers to deliver their messages in the voice mail boxes and thus totally eliminate the chances of missing any important business deal. Voice mail is also capable of simultaneously handling multiple calls. Voice mail service is mainly provided with the existing PBX phone systems and can effectively manage all inbound and outbound business calls.
As many of us may be aware, http://www.todsoutletufficiale.com , Voicemail has two basic modes of operation - Telephone Answering and Voice Messaging. The function of Telephone Answering mode is to answer external calls and takes a message when the extension is either busy or no- response. The function of Voice Messaging is for any subscriber, http://www.todsoutletufficiale.com , (...) , with a mailbox number, (...) , to send messages directly to any one or many subscribers mailboxes without first calling them.
Unlike an answering machine, http://www.airjordancenlignefr.com , which is no more than equipment, http://www.airjordancenlignefr.com , Voice Mail is centralized computer-based system of managing telephonic messages for a large group of people. Apart from fulfilling the standard functions of an answering machine, (...) , http://www.lunetteoakleyeuboutique.com , Voice Mail is capable of many other advanced features such as:
(i) Handling several phone calls at the same time. (ii) Storing all incoming messages in personal voice mailbox. (iii) Forward received messages into any other voice mailbox. (iv) Simultaneously send messages to more than one user voice mailbox. (v) Option to add a voice introduction when forwarding a message. (vi) Store in reserve voice messages for future delivery. (vii) Alert the user whenever messages are received in his/her mailbox through a phone call or paging service. (viii) Play different message greetings to different callers.
Voice mail service in a business house can mean better customer care service leading to increased productivity. The service can be programmed to provide the customers important information regarding your products and services on a 24/7 basis. Voice mail service is offered at affordable rates so that even small and start-up businesses can avail this extremely useful facility. With an affordable office voice mail service, small businesses can considerably improve their profile and acquire a big image.

jgekgw6n32 [Jun 30, 2012 at 02:31 AM] Author: Michelle Beaudry Article Tools: You're Ready for Advanced Hypnosis , (...) You've been to hypnotists and are ready to continue the work on your own. You do not want anyone else guiding your work, you want to be in charge. You want a way to make your experience unique each time, (...) , tailored to your immediate needs. There is a way to do that, and it is called The Spa of Your Inner Mind.
Guided Imagery Gets To Be Just Too Guided The suggestions hypnotists make are limited, typically by the limitations of the hypnotists themselves, that is to say, http://www.poloralphlaurenuenligne.com , by their preconceived notions. And it is common for advanced enthusiasts of inner work to reach a point where they are ready to take on all of the reins themselves. If you are at that point, read on.
Create The Spa of Your Inner Mind Drop down into a nice, comfy level and trance and create your own personal, private place of healing, (...) , transformation, insight and change. Think of it as a healing resort. Design your Spa in any way you like. Some folks choose the beach, others choose the mountains, (...) , some like the country, some like the city. It is your Spa. Choose wherever you like.
Your Spa Includes a Building and Grounds The building can be large or small, modern or old fashioned, whatever suits your tastes. The grounds can be lush or sparse, may contain gardens or streams, can be woods or sandy shores. How it looks is only limited to your personal likes.
Your Building Contains Special Rooms The names of the rooms reflect the activities you undertake inside them. The most common one is the Healing Room, (...) , and it is used for any kind of healing, whether emotional, http://www.burberrypascherienligne.com , physical, spiritual, (...) , (...) , or so forth. The next most useful room is the Insight Room, and you will enter there to get insight into your circumstances. Another favorite room is called the Room of Detoxification, and it goes beyond the mere removal of physical toxins, since it is equally good for removing emotional negativity. The next big favorite is the Dead Genius Cafe, where you have access to the greatest minds of all time, all happy to consult with you upon whatever issues you choose. Lastly, a delightful way to end your Spa visit is by choosing either the Fun Room or the Play Room so you can have a few moments of simple enjoyment. All rooms expand in size or alter in any way at any time to augment your experience. You simply enter the room, and have the experience.
Additional Rooms Are Limited Only by Your Intention You can create rooms especially for yourself. A few examples include the Room of Making Peace with The Past, the Vengeance Room, the Forgiveness Room, and the Room of Curing (place name of illness here). Simply choose an issue you want to work on, (...) , create a room with that name, enter it, and have the experience you most need to have at that time within the parameters you have set yourself.
It Is Never the Same Experience Twice Let us use the Healing Room as our example. Perhaps one time you need to heal a broken heart, the next time you need to heal a stubbed toe, (...) , (...) , and the next you want to heal your relationship with God. All of these and more are possible. Your own subconscious mind will create whatever you need at that time in accordance with your intention. And this goes for every room you enter. You go inside and your experience unfolds for you, uniquely.
The One Big Rule You have all the power at your Spa. What you say goes at your Spa at all times. At the speed of thought, http://www.burberrypascherienligne.com , anything you need is there for you, including people, facilities, equipment, and spiritual entities such as angels, spirit guides, or departed loved ones with whom you need to communicate. It is your Spa, (...) , and you have all the power here at all times.
Is There an Easier Way? Yes, (...) , there is an easier way."The Spa of Your Inner Mind"CD takes you through all the steps in under an hour, combining music, narration, and detailed instructions. You are able to experience your own Spa Rooms privately, in your own time, in your own home. The Rooms included are Healing, Insight, Detox, the Dead Genius Cafe, and then your choice of either the Fun or the Play Room. Welcome to a breakthrough in hypnosis technique, one in which you tailor your experience to your own needs each and every time you visit The Spa of Your Inner Mind.
Your mind is more powerful than you've ever been told. Learn how to create a place of transformation for yourself, and how to use it.
